author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Election Commission will release the draft electoral rolls by January 20.

If voters have changes, they could do so in the 15 days, said Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni here on Tuesday.

He was speaking to reporters at the Tamil Nadu Agricultural University after reviewing the progress in electoral rolls preparation in western districts.

He said that ahead of elections, the Election Commission would monitor social media campaigns using a software. The software would be able to distinguish paid and unpaid campaigns.

Responding to a question, he said that the Commission was preparing a list of those candidates who had not filed expenditure statements after the last election. It was also following up on the poll code violation cases.

Prior to the polling date, voters would get short message service on the polling booth and details of their entries in the voters’ list.

Collectors, Superintendents of Police, and Commissioners of Police from The Nilgiris, Coimbatore, Tirupur, Erode, Namakkal, Salem, Dharmapuri, and Krishnagiri districts participated.
title: Assembly polls: social media campaigns to be monitored
